data.title: AWP: The Writer's News
data.meta_description: The Writer’s News keeps you informed about new developments in the writing world, including award and publication announcements.
data.text:
September 1, 2007

Spanish Publisher Decides to Publish the Erotic Poems of a Nobel Laureate

Juan Ramón Jiménez, who won the Nobel Prize for Literature two years before his death in 1956, wrote erotic poems about his “amatory adventures” with several nuns. Read more...

September 1, 2007

Tabloid Books, Inc. of Santa Monica, California Finds a new way to publish and distribute books

They have started organizing stories in newspaper formatting, printed in a tabloid style. Read more...

September 1, 2007

Medi-Café: Trans-Maghreb Creative Writing Project

The British Council, in partnership with the University of London in Paris, has sponsored an online creative writing program for students and writers from the Maghreb. Read more...

September 1, 2007

U.S. Book Title Output Increased in 2006

R.R. Bowker’s Books in Print database reported in May that book publishing in the United States is up more than 3% from 2005 to 2006, introducing 291,920 new titles and editions last year. Read more...

September 1, 2007

Pennsylvania Faculty Strike

In response to a strike threat by the Association of Pennsylvania State College and University Faculties (APSCUF), the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education (PASSHE) offered a tentative agreement in contract negotiation on Tuesday, July 3. Read more...

May 1, 2007

Loft Literary Center Begins New Executive Director Search

Linda Myers, the Minneapolis-based Literary Center’s Executive Director since 1994, has announced her retirement. Read more...

May 1, 2007

Southern Methodist University Bids Fond Farewell to Marshall Terry

After more than fifty years as professor at SMU, Professor Marshall Terry will retire at the age of seventy-six. Read more...

May 1, 2007

Jonathan Lethem Gets Creative with His Copyright

Publisher’s Weekly states that the author announced on his website that he is offering the film rights to his forthcoming novel to a filmmaker of his choosing, free of cost. Read more...

May 1, 2007

Past AWP Board President Publishes New Novel

Susan Hubbard’s new novel, The Society of S is, according to Simon and Schuster, the publisher, “an ingenious twist on a beloved genre. Read more...
